Game
Class Level

java.lang.Object
  Game.Level

public class Level
extends Object

The Level class is used to load a level created in photoshop. We keep track of the tiles and width and height in this class. It is also important to note that all of the entities are created, destroyed, and stored in this class. Lukers 1/28/14

Constructor Summary
Level(String imagePath)
          Created a level from an imagePath or creates a default level if the imagePath is null

Constructor Detail

Level

public Level(String imagePath)
Created a level from an imagePath or creates a default level if the imagePath is null

Method Detail

addEntity

public void addEntity(Entity entity)
Adds an entity to the arraylist of entities.

alterTile

public void alterTile(int x,
                      int y,
                      Tile newTile)
This changes a certain tile in the level. Shouldn't need to use this if levels are created correctly.

generateLevel

public void generateLevel()
Generates a random level. Only used if the level imagePath is null.

getBullet

public Bullet getBullet(int x,
                        int y,
                        int playerWidth,
                        int playerHeight)
Returns a bullet at the passed in x and y. Returns null if there is no bullet at those coordinates. This is used later for hit detection.

getMainPlayer

public Player getMainPlayer()
Returns the main player of the game.

getTile

public Tile getTile(int x,
                    int y)
Returns the tile at a passed in x and y coordinate.

playerZombieCollision

public int playerZombieCollision()
Returns the number of zombies that are touching the player at any given time. The more zombies on the player, the more health the player loses.

removeEntity

public void removeEntity(int index)
Removes an entity with the index. Also changes all of the other entities' indexes in the array list listed after the removed index to minus one.

renderEntities

public void renderEntities(Screen screen)
Renders all of the entities and then renders the player last. Rendering the player last puts the player on top of everything.

renderTiles

public void renderTiles(Screen screen,
                        int xOffset,
                        int yOffset)
Renders all of the tiles in the level to the screen and set the x and yOffset. Offsets are used when the screen that we see isn't large enough for the level that is created.

reset

public void reset()
Resets the arrayList of entities so only the player is remaining. This essentially resets the level.

tick

public void tick()
Calls the tick for every entity in the level. This is how all of the entities are synchronized.
